summary:
Passionate and energetic sustainability professional dedicated to push and support companies to produce fair and sustainable products in their supply chains. Fascinated by the interaction between concrete, practical solutions and opportunities for systemic impact and change. Experienced in advising and engaging with international companies on issues related to responsible business conduct, such as labour rights, gender equality and transparency, developing and executing international campaigns and working on multiple complex projects simultaneously. Proven to be strategic, conscientious and result oriented. 

Contact:
✉ cvollaard@gmail.com
✆ +31 6 497 80 497

profile_positions.description: I advice companies in implementing human rights due diligence and conducting human rights impact assessments. I also support and advice NGOs/ civil society in implementing campaigns and programs related to business and human rights, and I conduct research in human rights violations in various food and beverage supply chains.
profile_positions.title: Business and Human Rights Consultancy

profile_positions.description:
This position lies in Oxfam (Novib)’s food and justice campaign, in which Oxfam (Novib) advocates for local, national and global public and private sector policies in the areas of land, climate change, investment, income and human rights that promote the food security, prosperity and resilience of small-scale producers and their communities. In this role, I am responsible for developing and implementing effective influencing and advocacy strategies that convince decision makers in the area of business and human rights with a focus on the food sector, and includes working on the Behind the Barcodes campaign. (see link below)

Responsibilities:
● Lead and contribute to the development of evidence based policy propositions, advocacy strategies and research, in co-ordinaton with Oxfam teams, country offices, partners and allies towards private and public actors
● Advocate the agreed evidence based policy positions by means of conversations, letters, and engagement with (online) media.
● Write the production of policy briefings, media articles and research
● Initiate and work together on the development of new projects and programs and ensure quality delivery of agreed outcomes with existing back donors
